review: Great icon pack. There simply isn't, as far as I am aware, another icon pack as comprehensive as this one that is also free. I have two minor issues though. First, personally, I find a lot of the icons can be rather similar. There's a lot of boxy icons with little color variation, some of them just ignoring the color of the original (T-mobile). Second, I use SwiftKey and the keyboard will not appear initially when I use the search feature. I have to tap the caret to make the keyboard appear.
ras4vb: Hi! Thank you for the kind words! Your feedback is appreciated. I will go ahead and fix T-Mobile icon color. As for the similar icons, we do use the same palette for consistency purpose and often pick square and circle icons shapes by default. We tend to go free form when the icon looks better that way. I'll look into the keyboard issue.

review: since I swapped to delta I've never wanted to go back. I love that each update you can request new addons altho not all are quick to include (I understand more popular apps get added before, so I'm not mad); I wish there was a way to requests alternatives, since ex. arcaea icon is too distinct from my other icons. also maybe have a filter related to colour/shape as I use ambiguous-looking icons on apps that haven't been added yet. just my 5 cents though, and maybe not all users think like me!
ras4vb: Hi, feel free to request alternatives or report outdated icons by sending a bugs report through the app; this is the best way as of now. As for filter I'm guessing you mean new tabs in the icons page.. that could be done although it would be a mess to manage and require more of our time so less for actual icons creation unfortunately.

review: Hands down my favorite icon pack, however, I've been running into this issue where I cannot search for specific icons within the app. Very frustrating bug that doesn't seem to be going away
ras4vb: Keyboard will show up if you press icon name "zone". This issue has been around since Android 12 came out. I do believe next CandyBar version will fix it. Unfortunately it is out of our control.

review: I love the icons but what made me give you 5 stars was that you have an icon for Arknights. I've seen icons for some games but never seen one for Arknights which is my favorite mobile game. Also, you have icons for every app that I use regularly (this includes apps like Instander, Tachiyomi, ReadEra premium) which are not very well known so you really deserve 5 stars. I just found out you have an icon even for Summertime Saga.

Wonderful icon pack to match with a dark theme. Pastel colors on a matte background made for a really pleasing look paired with my launcher, and included icons for a surprising amount of third party apps (great for those experimenting with F-Droid)!
For a free icon pack, the amount of icons they have is amazing. If you like more pastel and simplified icons, this would be the app for you.

I've seen all the icons that are available and they look really nice but ONE PROBLEM. I can't apply the icons because the app doesn't not support Moto App Launcher. Please add support for Moto App Launcher.
ras4vb: Unfortunately, most stock launchers don't support third party icon packs.

review: I am stunned by how many apps are supported. Only ones missing for me are local banking apps etc. Great minimalistic icon pack with pastel colours.
Huge number of icons and updates are big. Free app requests very limited, but considering how extensive it is it's pretty much not needed.
My icon pack suddenly change, I can't use delta even though I try to install it manually. The menu has disappeared (??) I use poco launcher

I've used Delta for the last few years and I really love the icons. However I can't recommend it at the moment as more than a handful of times I've updated the app and pretty much every icon is wrong. This is currently the case for me, hence 1 star. At this moment in time, the app is fundamentally broken. Response to Dev feedback: Thanks for responding to the review, for what's it's worth, I already cleared the app cache and reinstalled the app completely. Unfortunately the problem persists.
ras4vb: Icons should no longer be applied randomly after each update as we removed a feature that most likely was causing the issue on Oppo's phones. We apologize for the inconvenience and invite you to clear app data/cache before re-applying Delta. Following updates should be fine.

review: This is my favourite icon pack and I have tried about 30-40 different ones. The colours are carefully chosen, they really work well together and make every icon aesthetically pleasing. There are many icons to choose from so thankfully I didn't have any problems finding a substitute for a missing one. Although I wish there was an option to request a few problematic ones. Overall, best icon pack which I've been using for more than a year, switching back to it constantly.

I like the app so far. It was just what I was looking for to give my phone a more personalized touch. However, some apps didn't change icons eventhough the app has an icon for it. For example, my old icon for contacts is the same instead of the Delta version. I wish I could pick and choose which icons I would like for apps that don't switch automatically.
ras4vb: Your launcher might support manually choosing an icon by long pressing on it and offering an edit option. otherwise feel free to send me a bug report through Deltas settings.

review: This is what I want for icons but I would love for it to be more vibrant. It's a bit too soft for me.
Definitely the best icon pack for minimalist people.

How is there no icon for the EE app? The biggest mobile phone provider in the UK, yet you've got Vodafone & O2, which have about half the customer base of EE! I share data amongst my family so the EE app sits right on my home screen. Not having it themed totally spoils the aesthetic so can't use this pack. I refuse to believe it hasn't already been requested by plenty of others.
ras4vb: We're not always adding icons due to their popularity. Vodafone was added on 1.1.0 as the creator of this app probably use it (or used to) and a contributor added o2 later on, perhaps for the same reason. That's one of the priviledges of contributing to this project. A kind email would've resolved this issue; you can request the icon instead.

review: Icons are cute and the colours are attractive, but there is almost no visual cohesiveness in terms of shapes. Some icons are square, some are rectangular, and some are other shapes entirely (Google Play is just a triangle, OneDrive is a cloud, etc). It's a little frustrating to try to get a nice consistent- looking home screen when it looks like your icons are selected from three or four different themes.
I love the icons but why is the notification bar not changed?
Looks great! Would love to know what the launcher / wallpaper is in the second image (plain white with coloured time date etc.)
ras4vb: Hi! You can find the widget in huk KWGT pack

review: Wow, where to begin! I have been using this icon pack for well over 6 months consistently, to the point where the default icon pack looks abnormal and too vibrant. The muted colors really blend well with my aesthetic. Pastel colors wree always my choice, and having this option for an icon pack really completes my phone theme. If you sre looking for an icon pack where the icons are as not as vibrant and can blend well with a pastel/light color scheme, Delta is for you.
Absolutely incredible icon pack with a nice color pallette and lots of icons. And it's open source! Love it!

the icons look cool and I guess that's all you'd require from an icon pack. the app, however, doesn't allow you to request icons explicitly, or at least I'm dumb enough not to get it. you're told that there's an option to do so (reading FAQ can really be useful!), but after searching for it for a couple of minutes I came to a conclusion that it appears missing or you're supposed to magically unlock it. either way, this sucks.
ras4vb: Thanks for pointing out the FAQ part, i'll remove it as the option is disabled (as you noticed). I simply can't keep up with the demand while having a life.

review: Very happy with the aesthetic so far, although the light colours on an amoled screen get a bit strained to look at. This would be perfect if there was a saturation and brightness slider to uniformly adjust colour across the icons. Luckily enough the included wallpaper selection is perfect and avoids any issues of matching with background. Thanks!

Love the icons and love that almost all my installed apps were included (including specifically Dutch apps). However, I don't understand the design choice for the phone icon. I prefer a traditional phone shape, it's more immediately recognisable. I can't see where to change this if possible.
Best free icon pack

A superb icon pack. Original and pleasant to the eyes, it's aesthetically beautiful and gave my phone a very needed new look. I found out that I don't need any other icon pack, this one has all the necessary icons, a consistent design and awesome pastel colors. Unfortunately every time that it is updated it completely messes my custom icon choices and very few icons remain correct. So I give it 4 stars instead of 5.

This is probably the best icon pack I have tried on an Android device, It covers all of my apps on all of my devices, these pastel icons look nice on my home screen, (and can look nice on a somewhat dark wallpaper that is not busy.), no ads in the app, and best of all, unlike a lot of the icon packs I tried in the past, it's open-source, so one can be able to create and submit their own icons to complete their set of icons, despite the fact you can only request 1 icon per version via the app.

I like delta because it really does work with the flat color aesthetic I have going. What I don't love about it is how frequently it breaks. Every time it updates, my entire home screen is assigned randomized icons, forcing me to often disable Delta in hopes that it is fixed a few days later. I'm not mad, I'm just disappointed.

Outstanding. I've used this icon pack for years. It is continually updated with new app icons and they always look great and keep the theme well. Amazing work, truly. It's rare to find a project that is so consistent in its quality and support.

Icons look great and there's plenty of them to cover other apps. Nice selection of stylish wallpapers as well. It's easy to apply the icon set, and scroll through a nicely curated set of wallpapers when you want a new look. Unobtrusive ads. Excellent app, will donate. Thanks!

update: year and a half later and this is still my favorite pack, but I'm still having the same frustration with it. I so wish there were 'miscellaneous' icons so that everything matched neatly! gotta downgrade my rating... / love these! would love several more non app specific options (heart, star, speech bubble, etc?) since they're hard to match with other icon packs

My favorite icon pack, icons are simple and easy to install. They are also regularly updated and you can request icons for certain apps. I've tried a lot of different icon apps but this one definitely has the sleekest and easiest to navigate design.

Edit to dev: I reinstalled the app after a month and lastpass works now. So should be all good now. Really like the app, only hiccup was that I couldn't use lastpass properly. If you don't use lastpass then enjoy this app, it works great otherwise! Somehow delta and lastpass didn't agree. Password management is really important to the use of my phone, I can't go without it so I uninstalled delta to use lastpass again.
ras4vb: If you could send me a bug report throug hthe apps settings i will gladly take a look into it :)

review: Beautiful icons and wallpapers. I have been using this icon pack on iOS and Android for the last 5 or so years now and will continue to use it. Thousands of apps with plenty of wallpaper options. Even if you don't like the wallpapers that are included, the icons work wonderfully with personal wallpapers as well. If you don't have a launcher chosen yet, I personally recommend LibreChair which unfortunately is only on GitHub but we'll worth it.

This is absolutely the best icon pack I've ever come across! I've tried many in my lifetime and I continue to search for different ones to try out, but there is just none out there as beautiful, trendy, and minimalist as this one. Plus the wallpapers are all gorgeous 😍

This app is awesome and is easily my favorite free icon pack. My one small request would be for then to change the default phone icon, because the current default really doesn't look like a phone. They make it easy enough to change though, so it's not a huge problem.

Simple and clean, but very pretty and artistic. Colors are tastefully selected to give the same calm vibe, and the designs/lines/shapes are all just very pleasing to the eye. If I could request, please make an icon for BDO mobile banking app!
ras4vb: Thank you for the feedback! Please use the icon request tool provided in the app

review: Love the pack. One of the best out there. Only thing I miss is a "Premium Icon Request" feature to get the missing icons faster, like some others packs do. Keeping in mind that the pack is free, the current icon count is not so bad either.

This pack is byfar the most amazing pack I have ever installed. Great quality, but when I tried to set up the Gmail icon, nothing showed up. But when I did all the other Google icons, that icon showed up. I'm not sure if this is a glitch or not but it doesn't annoy me as much.

Looks great and is easy to use; there's a great variety of icons to choose from, and several variations of certain icons (like the calculator for example) which makes it nicer for customizing. I just wish there was a Chick-fil-A app icon!
